results.title: Morris loves Jack
results.brief_description: A star studded short drama, Morris Loves Jack is an off-beat romance between Jack, a young policewoman and Morris, the charming but feckless out of work actor who shares her house and her money. She is happy to support him emotionally and financially in spite of his irresponsible attitude to life until she finds him in the arms of another. Starring Kris McQuade and John Hargraves

results.title: Lovely day
results.brief_description: Lovely Day is a masterpiece of painterly animation art. Painstakingly rendered in the style of Hieronymus Bosch, the central character and accompanying putto-like figures evoke memories of a time when the pianola was the price of the parlour and partying involved an old fashioned knees up sing along.

results.title: Lost
results.creator_credit: Jo Kennedy, Clare Sawyer and Ros Walker
results.brief_description: Three small children have been wandering a city beach. What begins as a seemingly routine case for detectives in Missing Persons becomes a puzzle. Twenty-four hours later no one has reported them missing and the police start to worry. Why can’t they locate their parents and why won’t the children speak?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jo Kennedy, Clare Sawyer and Ros Walker

results.title: Life at the top
results.brief_description: Radiating from dreary Housing Commission high-rise flats come the personalities of colourful individuals who have created their own worlds in a potentially depressing situation. The dull grey concrete of these Commission flats hides a complex and appealing world where a theatre woman celebrates her past, a man makes surprising use of all the flotsam and jetsam of his life, and each person has a small story to tell.

results.title: Kitchen sync
results.brief_description: A variety of domestic images, both animated and live action, combine to produce an energetic dance of life.
results.description: A variety of domestic images, both animated and live action, combine to produce an energetic dance of life.

results.title: Journey (Sen)
results.brief_description: A young boy leaves his isolated home town hitching across a forever changing landscape. His travels cause him to relive fragments of the life left behind as he struggles to find rest in a journey that may never end. An award winning short from Indigenous filmmaker Ivan Sen whose other films include Tears, Wind and Dust.

results.title: Icon
results.brief_description: A comedy about the gender of god and the real wishes of the Virgin Mary. Hugely successful, this one minute short has screened at festivals throughout Australia and Europe, and at the United Women’s Conference in Beijing.

results.title: Has beans
results.creator_credit: Andrew Tamandl, AFTRS and Miriam Stein
results.brief_description: The world is full of war and where can we hope to escape it? Home? - Certainly not by a stretch of this little computer animation. A lone kidney bean is being given the rough treatment by two much larger, bullying lima beans. In a number of fancy manoeuvres the kidney bean tricks the bullying two into believing they’ve killed him. When the kidney bean reaches his kin a battle of revenge is planned. The plan is foiled once ensconced in battle by the true ruler - he/she who cooks beans in the kitchen. The battle scenes are stylistically similar to and remniscent of the battle scenes in the paintings of Australian artist, John Bracks, where he used pencils and decks of cards symbolically and as structural elements to recreate battle scenes. No dialogue, sound effects only.

results.title: Harry's War ( Crossing Tracks )
results.creator_credit: Richard Frankland, Jill Bilcock and John Foss
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crossing Tracks Series”.
Harry, a Koorie, and Mitch, a non-Aboriginal Australian, are two mates who go off to fight in Papua New Guinea during the Second World War. Harry grows from a boy in uniform to a man in war. We watch as he learns of his impending death and how he faces it. ‘Harry’s War’ is about when mateship transcends race, cultural differences and social barriers. It is a story of how war drives men to the brink and the journey becomes more important than the journey’s end. Cast includes: David Ngoombujarra, Peter Docker, Glenn Shea, Bob Maza and Christina Saunders.
